explicit.speaker: Sudheer
explicit.text: But it's still not fully, fully clear, right?

explicit.speaker: manuele
explicit.text: However, I still have to understand. Then what does it conflict in terms of operational efficiency from the next weeks?

explicit.speaker: manuele
explicit.text: I maybe need to have some clarification on the holacracy principle.

explicit.speaker: manuele
explicit.text: And I am a bit in the dark now because I don't know how to approach either in my usual way of managing things.

explicit.speaker: John Stokes (Real Ventures)
explicit.text: I have been thinking and engaged in regeneration for some time, and I'm still not always sure what it is and what it isn't.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: We know that collaboration is the true architecture of evolution, where unity becomes strength, and diversity becomes harmony.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: We choose love as our compass, and integrity as our plan. We honor coherence, weaving finance, technology, and governance into service of life itself.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: So integrating financial, digital, physical, and cultural infrastructure. And that's our way of getting to that vision. And I hope this vision, this purpose. know. it this purpose. is inspiring enough for us collectively to take this action forward.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: So, just putting a seed there, that whatever has been shared... is a work in progress. there's a huge uncertainty. and especially at the beginning. and we have two choices to play with uncertainty. either we celebrate it with knowing that there is magic will unfold at some point of time and have the courage to walk through that uncertainty or we can embrace it with with concern and this is a choice that we make personally and we can make this choice but also we can make the other choice and this is for me here an invitation to embrace uncertainty and and for us collectively and I the responsibility for a better communication, starting with myself, and a clear communication. Because if anybody on this call says that I know exactly all the steps that we need to walk in the next six months or next one year or whatever it is, that's not true because nobody does. But we only know something, and that something is that we have a very strong connection of why we started this. And we know that we will face challenges and uncertainties, and we have to figure it out, including how to work together and how we align internally.

breakthroughs.speaker: Alex Alegria (metalucks.com)
breakthroughs.text: It's especially when you try to distribute power. It's easy when... In a startup, they launch a company, and one guy is named a founder, and then you keep running, and then you get this guy and the other guy, and so on, you know, that's easy. Some of you here are entrepreneurs, they've done that. That's actually easy. This is difficult. So, embracing this with an open heart, and this message for me first, and for you second. So, invite you to embrace that. Thank you.

breakthroughs.speaker: Iris Lubitch
breakthroughs.text: And the second thing is that the beauty is that compared to others, others, because we have values, and because we are committed for transparency, and trust, and courage, and love, this is our certainty, this, that's what give us certainty, at least for my side, I feel much safer here in this environment, compared to the jungle outside, so, that's what I wish to state, 60 seconds about certainty.

breakthroughs.speaker: Christopher Herghelegiu
breakthroughs.text: And I think Alex framed it pretty well in the beginning there, that this should feel like a very safe place to communicate. We have a pretty extensive, talented, unique group of people who their intent is to move this forward, and I've spoken with most of you individually. And, you know, I ask them a lot of simple questions like what's your whistlish and what you kind of want to see out of this. So I think that's really important for everybody to identify and feel that they understand what their abilities are and what their, you know, time constraints may be and what some of those needs are. Because I think as a collective group, we always got to be in care of each other. So I think it's important to have some semblance of what that means for you and be able to communicate that.

breakthroughs.speaker: Sudheer
breakthroughs.text: But see in whatever capacity you can to kind of drop that thing of, this is mine, this is me, this is what I should be doing for myself, and making it more about, this is what I want to do first. And then through that, work out a way for what I can get from this. That'll actually make things a lot better, because that's where I also see a bit of friction, to be honest.

breakthroughs.speaker: Olga Duka
breakthroughs.text: And a lot of things even, like, probably planned for the literally next hundred days might be overkill and need to be scaled down to be, like, way more realistic. So that not just we are capable of doing this, but also that we not feel overloaded every time we look into any plans and milestones and trying to assess things we can't possibly assess at the moment. And to be okay with that, as in, like, move slow. But in a more cohesive and calm way, achieving more, actually, while moving slower, but really having enough time and space for us to have transparent, heart-to-heart communications at all times, recognizing that we all have our personal, business, collective interests, and sometimes they will come in conflict, and that is just okay.

actions.speaker: Team Metaluck
actions.text: Post creed/values deck to Symbiosis General Hub

actions.speaker: Sudheer
actions.text: Schedule 3â€“4h MVS integration & tech infrastructure alignment call w/ relevant leads

actions.speaker: Christopher Herghelegiu
actions.text: Post Anchor Circle updates to Symbiosis after each meeting

actions.speaker: Nathalie Nebelius (Cordinata AB)
actions.text: Send bi-weekly Anchor Circle updates to ecosystem

actions.speaker: Nathalie Nebelius (Cordinata AB)
actions.text: Post questions/discussion points in Symbiosis General Hub

recommendations.text: Implement clear roles and responsibilities for each circle ASAP to streamline workload distribution and enable broader participation. This will address concerns about parallel work streams and allow more members to contribute effectively.
Encourage more explicit agreement/disagreement indicators, especially in discussions about operational strategies and integration, to improve consensus clarity and reduce ambiguity.
Organize a dedicated session to define 'regeneration' within the context of Better World, ensuring a common understanding and intentional application of the concept in decision-making.

Prioritize the MVS integration and tech infrastructure alignment call to resolve overlapping functionalities and create a cohesive internal tool ecosystem, reducing friction and improving operational efficiency.

Continue to foster an environment where members feel safe to express concerns and ask for help, as highlighted by the 'embrace uncertainty' and 'safe place to communicate' sentiments. This will strengthen relational health and psychological safety.

Develop a transparent compensation framework that values time and effort, addressing concerns about financial sustainability and aligning with the collective's values. This should include modalities for upfront and deferred compensation.

Adopt a 'move slow to move fast' approach, scaling down immediate plans to be more realistic and allowing sufficient time for transparent, heart-to-heart communications, especially given the complexity of the endeavor.
Actively promote and support the use of Symbiosis for all internal communications, questions, and document sharing to centralize information and enhance transparency across the ecosystem.
